thread.title: Marvel's The Inhumans Needs Alien Extras
thread.title_full: Marvel's The Inhumans Needs Alien Extras

author: Jay Jayson
title: Marvel's The Inhumans Needs Alien Extras
text:
Marvel's The Inhumans Needs Alien Extras Jay Jayson Back to Article Image of 
If you happen to live on the Hawaiian island of Oahu, have a burning desire to appear in a Marvel Studios production, and have an alien-like appearance, I have some fantastic news for you! 
Marvel's The Inhumans will be filming on Oahu (under the working title, "Project Next") and, according to a casting call posted by Ohana Casting , needs: "IDENTICAL TWINS 10-40yrs old - LITTLE PEOPLE - VERY TALL PEOPLE 6'4 AND TALLER- PEOPLE WITH CRAZY AND COLORFUL HAIR STYLES- BODY BUILDERS - AND FOLKS FROM AN INDIAN ANCESTRY!" 
If you fit any of those descriptions — and you're a resident of Oahu — you can submit a photo and phone number to ohanacasting@gmail.com. (Photo: Marvel Entertainment) 
The Inhumans, a race of superhumans with diverse and singularly unique powers, were first introduced in Marvel Comics by Stan Lee and Jack Kirby in 1965. Since that time, they have grown in prominence and become some of the most popular and iconic characters in the Marvel Universe. Marvel’s The Inhumans will explore the never-before-told epic adventure of Black Bolt and the royal family. 
Aside from Black Bolt, the royal family is also expected to include Medusa, Maximus, Karnak, Gorgon, Crystal, and Triton. At this time, no actors have been cast. 
The first two episode of Marvel’s The Inhumans (directed by Roel Reine) will premiere in over 1,000 IMAX theatres across the globe — for a two-week run — starting on September 4, 2017. ABC will then premiere the weekly television series on Tuesday, September 26. Marvel's Iron Fist showrunner Scott Buck is serving as its showrunner and as an executive producer.
